rComments: His class is mostly group presentations, meaning you won't learn much. Typically doesn't have a format, often rambles about the same five talking points, and doesn't really prepare you much for the final. I would still say that I learned a thing or two from the course, but I don't think it's because of him, but rather in spite of him.
LOVE THIS GUY TAKE HIS COURSES ITS A BLESSING

Hands down the best prof of my semester. He's very genuine and hilarious, and makes it very clear that he cares and wants everyone to succeed. Quizzes and assignments can actually help a lot with the material being learned in the main class (in this case it was psych). Overall really sweet man and would definitely recommend to anyone, esp. 1st year

By far the best professor you will get! He truly cares about his students. His class is not overly difficult, which is nice, especially if you have a heavy course load. That being said, I learned a lot in this class. I took it as a helper version for my French psychology class and I found it to be very useful. Don't skip out on this prof!

If you want to actually learn French, don't take this class. If you want an easy A+, and enjoy useless talking for 90% of each lecture, join this class. I have learned nothing from this class this semester. terrible terrible prof. Don't take this class.

Prof. Bellavance est un professeur enthousiaste et un militant pour les droits étudiants. Même avec la pandémie, il pouvait recréer un environnement intime où on pouvait participer et s'engager à des discussions intéressantes. La participation est intégrante, alors ne prennez pas ce prof en ligne si vous allez garder votre caméra fermé.

He is a great person and a great professor. The first thing youll notice is that there is no required textbook and his reasoning behind that is one book alone cannot teach you French, this saves students money as well. His teaching methods are very stimulating especially for an online zoom class. He cares about his students and makes it simple.

Guy is a legend, had him for both FLS2511 and FLS2512 and his teaching methods were the same for both courses. He is consistent, great at explaining things and makes sure the students had enough resources and practice before going into tests or the final exam. He gives hints too and if he sees you are trying and putting in an effort he considers it

I love this prof! One of the best at uO. I did French immersion in high school but I hadnt spoken or used in French in 5 YEARS and forgot a lot of French. I took this class to try and use French again. He helped explain lots of concepts and grammar I didnt understand from high school! He simplified lots of things and made me enjoy relearning it

I cant believe i PAID for grade 10 french to be taught to me. we would literally spend MONTHS on lexical chains. bro we know what synonyms are. i didnt learn anything, especially to be better at reading and writing. oh and never expect feedback to be given. easy for an A but pointless if you actually wanna learn something.
He genuinely wants students to learn

Professor Belavance is hands down the best teacher Ive ever had. He treats you like the paying adult that you are and understands the value of you and how much you merit a good education. There are no tricks, no gotcha questions... He is very clear on everything and expressed from the first class how easy it is to get a high mark in his course.

I loved this class, professor Belavance was always ready and energetic to teach. He got to know the students and made the lectures fun. If you have the chance, take a class with him, you won't regret it!

Prof. Bellavance is so chill and caring to his students. He assigned very minimal work across the semester - 5 assignments + the final exam. Attendance COUNTS, make sure you are there! Tests are all vocabulary, final exam was auditory & reading comprehension based. Make sure you speak up in class or he WILL pick on you! An easy GPA boost for sure.

By far the best prof I had this term. Being a first year student, he made class a lot more fun and he genuinely cares for his students. He's very chill and easy to talk to. I would highly recommend taking his classes!
Monsieur Bellavance is amazing!! He is approachable, laid-back, and really cares about his students. If you are an immersion student I definitely recommend him!!

Not only an awesome prof, but an awesome person. He's super funny, would always give hints on tests and exams. His exam is super easy. If you're taking an immersion class, I definitely recommend this professor as he will be extremely helpful and wants to see everyone succeed. He's available for any assistance in French grammar as well.
Whatever you do, take a class with this prof. He is one of the best. His class is not too difficult, and he is a fair marker. Definitely would take this class again.

Bellavance is an extremely laidback prof who just wants students to do well. While I did sometimes find his teaching style a little all over the place, it was a super easy course and his expectations were always crystal clear.
Do everything you can to get a course with this prof. That's all I have to say.

I was really worried about FLS classes before my first year and he was the perfect prof. He helped with the understanding of vocabulary words as all his tests were vocab and we did one presentation that is super easy to do well on.

Best prof. He really wants you to understand, and tries to make the class as stimulating as possible. I can look past his opinions lol. He gives you hints during tests and is an easy grader. He talks to students like friends and makes you feel comfortable in the class. He tries to build one-on-one relationships with students as well, which is nice.

Bellavance is the kind of prof that makes you want to attend class.  His expectations are clear, the work is not difficult, and he has some great personal insight.  He's clearly wants his students to do well and is very accessible.  If you're not a big fan of personal anecdotes, his class may not be for you, but overall a fantastic teacher.

This prof is quite helpful and a really easy marker. He can sometimes be quite rude however and spends much of the class rambling on about his opinions and life stories which can often feel like a waste of time. All you need to do to get a good mark is participate. If class participation isn't your thing, he is probably not the prof for you.

M Bellavance was my favourite prof during my first semester!! He was hilarious, always there to answer questions for assignments and tests are very straight forward! Definitely recommend him for FLS class, always WANTED to attend class! BEST PROF!!

Fun class to attend. Discussion topics are always interesting so it's easy to participate which leads to good marks and improved oral French. Super laid back prof. Very opinionated and likes to debate controversial issues but I think he just does it so students will get defensive and want to participate.
Super easy not many assignments. Lots of marks for participation and speaking in French.

Great prof! Pushes his students out of their comfort zones though, especially with oral presentations (and gives participation marks) so if you don't like that, don't take his courses. Apart from that, super helpful, super encouraging, gives very clear feedback and is always very clear on expectations. Easy high marks.

Easiest class! Lots of opportunities to get a good grade, exam was straightforward and exactly what we were told to expect. However, he talks... A LOT. If you can bite your tongue and let him ramble on about his opinions, then you will do fine. With patience, you can get an easy A or A+.

Great class, good prof. ALthough he did spend quite a bit of time talking, likes to hear the sound of his own voice. But fair marker and classes are really interesting, lots of discussion and opportunity to practice speaking French. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

great teacher, honestly. it's true that he does a lot of the talking but he does try to get people to participate. i'm surprised to hear about him being "creepy", i never got that vibe from him. he likes to joke with people and class is basically just people telling stories which is sweet for a french speaking course. def recommend

Easily one of the best profs ever. Super clear, never leaves a student behind, playful while being efficient, teaches things other teachers have failed to teach me in new and better ways, felt so prepared for exam. He will tease the class but it's all in jest, to stimulate participation. This guy rocks and I wish he taught all of my french classes.
great prof

Best prof I've ever had..Had him a couple times now. Originally, I dreaded grammar and wasnt comfortable with it. He made the class fun and thanks to him, I came out having learned more than I've ever learned in a grammar class. He's also very approachable, which helped when we had questions. Need a sense of humour if taking his courses!

Good prof, but for an oral class I found he did most of the talking. Also watch out girls, without wanting to slander, he can get a little close for comfort. The prof-student fantasy is better sought elsewhere...
great prof!

Great prof for beginner french. Very easy to understand his french. Course is very vague and not much is taught. Focuses more so on the written aspect of PC and imparfait as opposed to oral skills. He will pick on you infront of class if you don't make the attempt to speak french/seem engaged.
awesome professor...very easy to understand when speaking in french

Unique prof...if he's taught u before and likes u then you'll def get a good mark...funny guy nice as well..but picks on the quiet ones way too much.. makes u feel really stupid..ended up with a B but wouldnt take any class with him again...rather make myself feel stupid then have him do that...if u like being a suck-up this class is for u

Really interesting and intelligent person. Great teaching method. Instead of focusing on grammar, he uses the immersion approach and makes language learning that much more organic. Unfortunately, I didn't learn very much but that is more the fault of the course content than the professor's. Would love to have him again.

Has a really great approach to teaching. quite the opposite of learning dry grammar, he makes it interactive so you actually remember. he also makes you talk in class, which you dread, but really helps your improvement the most. He's a nice guy, really funny.
Favors certain students. Does note help those who are having difficulty at all. Likes to talk about himself.
absolutely amazing. would love to have him every class but doesn't teach very often. makes french class enjoyable. a must have!!
Sorry in the previous comment I wanted to say that he makes statements that are rac*#t and se*ist.

Seemed cool at first, class was lots of fun. Towards the middle of the semester though he got creepy and started asking me to meet him after class and when I did it was just so we could talk alone about life, etc. I know two other girls who have been in two of his different classes and he has done the same thing.  Watch out girls!!
